intro: Rytigynia lebrunii, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Rytigynia lebrunii is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
